title: Technology-Enhanced Vocabulary Learning: Digital Flashcards and Video Integration with Self-Regulated Learning (SRL)

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-Level Social Studies Vocabulary and Basic Digital Tool Proficiency
context.additional_context: Learners are either job seekers or non-degree course takers pursuing self-development, requiring acquisition of specialized social sector vocabulary. Participate in real-time online classes using digital devices and measure learning outcomes through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners acquire 200 intermediate-level social studies vocabulary items over four weeks using digital flashcards (DF) and video-enhanced (VE) tools
Learners improve vocabulary learning efficiency by 30% by applying self-regulated learning (SRL) strategies (goal setting, self-monitoring, feedback utilization)
Based on pre-existing vocabulary knowledge (PVK) levels, learners select either DF or VE tools and are assessed on word form recognition and meaning recall proficiency
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
